heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The highest recorded number of lightning strikes in a single day is {highest_count} on {highest_date} since records began on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: An active storm has been detected in the vicinity.  The last storm experienced was on 26 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 6 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical.status: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (185°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 311 m) and light levels (up 2806 lux).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 3959 lux) and cloud levels (up 218 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 310.8m lower than yesterday, 96.5m lower than the past week, 217.5m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 845m to a maximum of 2560m, averaging 1093.5m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1190.0m and 1311.0m respectively.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; mild and pleasant. Also, neither too dry nor too humid and little or no wind. Showers, the sky may alternate between sunny and overcast, and light levels will be low during the day. Low pressure may lead to stormy or rainy weather.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (88%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
